triples.name: Collision avoidance system
triples.relevance: The core problem domain the paper addresses with its novel optimization-based approach.

triples.name: Convex optimization
triples.relevance: The foundational mathematical framework used to reformulate collision avoidance constraints.

triples.name: Convex set
triples.relevance: Objects and controlled entities are represented as unions of convex sets in the proposed method.

triples.name: Strong duality
triples.relevance: Core theoretical principle used to exactly reformulate nondifferentiable constraints into smooth constraints.

triples.name: Signed distance function
triples.relevance: The paper connects its reformulation results with signed distance, which is widely used in traditional trajectory generation.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Generic navigation and trajectory planning tasks where the proposed framework can be applied.

triples.name: Gradient descent
triples.relevance: Gradient-based optimization algorithm enabled by the smooth differentiable constraints.

triples.name: Newton's method in optimization
triples.relevance: Hessian-based second-order optimization algorithm made applicable by the smooth constraint reformulation.

triples.name: Automatic parking
triples.relevance: Demonstration domain where the framework's effectiveness is validated on an automated parking problem.

triples.name: Collision avoidance constraint reformulation
triples.relevance: Novel exact reformulation of nondifferentiable collision avoidance constraints into smooth, differentiable constraints using strong duality.
